releases.details: Released as part of the Kamelion Tales boxset and as an individual release in Region 1 on 7 September 2010.
special_features: Commentary by Peter Davison, Isla Blair, and Eric Saward
Bonus commentary by director Tony Virgo for Part One only
Kamelion - Metal Man - A short history of the Doctor's robotic companion
Magna Carta - Investigating the Magna Carta and its relevance through history

releases.details: Released as part of a boxed set with the Special Edition version of The Five Doctors.

notes: This story had working titles of The Android, The Demons, A Knight's Tale, and Demons Keeper.
Part one was promoted by the BBC as the 600th Doctor Who episode.
This is the first story to feature Anthony Ainley's Master that did not feature Adric or Nyssa.

real_world_cultural_references: Historical figure King John of England

continuity_notes: Tegan fears that the TARDIS's arrival is a trap by the Black Guardian.
Kamelion's story is connected to Xeriphas.
The Doctor is knighted here, although not by the genuine King John.

plot.plot_summary: In March 1215, King John of England extorts taxes at the castle of Sir Ranulf Fitzwilliam. Upon the TARDIS's arrival, the Doctor and companions are welcomed by the King, but the Doctor realizes that the King is not whom he claims to be. The Master appears disguised as Sir Gilles Estram and threatens the Doctor. The Master plans to use Kamelion, disguised as King John, to provoke rebellion, thus obliterating the Magna Carta. The Doctor duels the Master and regains control of Kamelion, thwarting the plan.
